content:
Clearing your download cache can solve problems with games that won't download or start.

[section style=note]  [h3]Note:[/h3]This process will not affect your currently installed games, but you will need to log into Steam afterwards.[/section]
[olist]
[*]From your Steam Client, open the Settings panel by selecting "Steam > Settings" from the top left client menu.

[*]In the Settings panel, select the Downloads tab and you'll find the "Clear Download Cache" button at the bottom.

[exclude_realm=china][img]http://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/steam/support/faq/clear_download_cache.jpg[/img][/exclude_realm]

[exclude_realm=global][img]http://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/steam/support/faq/chts/clear_download_cache.jpg[/img][/exclude_realm]
[*]Then select "OK" to confirm and acknowledge that you'll need to login to Steam again.

[exclude_realm=china][img]http://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/steam/support/faq/confirm_clear_cache.jpg[/img][/exclude_realm]

[exclude_realm=global][img]http://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/steam/support/faq/chts/confirm_clear_cache.jpg[/img][/exclude_realm]
[/olist]
If you're still having trouble with your downloads and any games that won't start, please contact [url=https://help.steampowered.com/]Steam Support[/url].
title: Clear download cache
